content.description: Start to the right of "Mini-Dihedral" at a left-facing, vertical crack (zig) with good, flat, left foothold. Find easy climbing to the horizontal, and the nice finger crack (zag) is above and to the right. The crux is the topout - I was spooked, because I didn't have a spotter, and it didn't have anything I can find that you can pull from at the top. Otherwise, it would've been a great V0.
content.protection: A pad and a spotter would help.
content.location: It is a few feet to the right of "Mini-Dihedral."

content.description: Sit start under the obvious starting holds, and go up to the good but spaced holds.
content.location: To the left of the Bulge Dyno about 5 feet, there is an obvious vertical seam.  Sit start there.

content.description: Side Crimps is a fun, little problem for people who likes crimps. Start on the right-facing crimps with a good foot rail underneath. Crimp away to a top out jug. The Broken Cascade arete is off route - stick to the face to the right of it.  Good footwork will make this feel pretty easy.  Bad footwork will make it feel much harder.
content.location: Start a few to the right of Broken Cascade. Look for the good side crimp above a really good right foot.

content.description: This ascends a long, vertical crack on the left side of Cliff 1’s south side. It has a nice sit start from the big, triangular inset.
content.location: Begin ~3 feet East of small, overhanging corner on the left side of the south face. The entire line is hidden in the shadow of a tree in original set of photos, hence the name....

content.description: Sit start using holds in the diagonal crack just left of the left jug used for "Bulge Dyno". That is done to separate the two climbs, plus the flat spot next to the jug is very good. Go for the really sharp crimp up and left, and then go for the jug a few feet over the crimp. It is basically over from there, and then move onto the topout and the walkoff.
content.location: Just to the left of the left jug of Bulge Dyno, sit start there.

content.description: Climb the obvious finger crack located in a dihedral. Have fun!
content.location: It is on the South-facing side of the cliff.

content.description: If you like crimps, this is the one for you. Start on crimps, go to another crimp, and then another...and so forth to the topout. This is a cool, little crimp ladder.
content.location: It is roughly 5 feet to the left Twist and Shout. A rock on the ground separates the two routes.

content.description: Cascade Dreams is a commiting route that make you wish you were doing Broken Cascades to its right. This is a fine route that start with good hands and feet. Commit to some moves that should deposit your hand right in the corner where the left-facing seam starts.  Delicately follow it up, and top out.
content.location: Look for a left-facing seam about 8 feet up. Start directly under that. You should be a couple feet to the left of Broken Cascade.

content.description: This is awesome dyno fun! Start with the same sit start as "Arete Slab Sit Start". Scrunchy traverse the low seam/rail to the next bulge/rounded arete. Good jugs for both your left and right hand will set you up for the committing dyno. Load up and fly!
content.location: Start at the same location as "Arete Slab Sit Start", go low on the traverse below the roof till you get to the jugs.

content.description: Broken Cascade is a good warm-up for the area. It looks V-easy, but the smooth, flat holds are slippery and pushed the grade up a notch, IMHO.
content.location: This is the one crystalline-looking line embedded into the ciff that's a shallow, left-facing dihedral. It's one of the first line on the right side of the cliff.

content.description: Sit start on the big rail under the small overhang. Make a big throw to the the good ledge at the top of the overhang, continue to traverse right, and follow the arête up. Join with Arête Slab Sit Start at the pinch halfway up the wall, and then top out the same as that route.
content.location: This starts on the big rail under the small overhang in the middle of the cliff. This is the big rail that Bulge Dyno uses.

content.description: This is a great climb on the arete with interesting movement that could rival Mini-Dihedral as the best climb at this cliff. Sit start to the left of Shadowed Hand Crack right on the arete. Technical movement will get you established for the slab on the left side of the arete.  Intricate climbing to finish up the slab, and top out.
content.location: To the left Shadowed Hand Crack right on the arete, sit start on good hands.

content.description: There is lots of varied terrain on this one little 8-12' cliff. There is a nice face, a mini-dihedral, and even a hand crack. All have very nice, solid rock.
